      static SolrQuery buildArchiveSearchParams(java.lang.String searchQuery, boolean debug)
      Constructs a search url that retrieves all matching records for a simple query in json format. Used for managing document updates when active and archived documents are in separate data stores.

      Retrieve the SolrSchemaConfigReader for the specified config file. Cached in production but read from disk each time in dev mode.

      static void wrapAndThrow(java.lang.Exception e)
      Utility method to ensure an exception is propagated upward typed as gw.solr.SolrException. Exceptions that are the correct type are simply thrown. All others are wrapped as SolrException and then thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • buildSearchParams

        SolrQuery buildSearchParams(java.lang.String searchQuery,
                          java.lang.String searchFilter,
                          java.lang.String groupField,
                          int groupLimit,
                          int fetchSize,
                          boolean debug)
        Constructs a search url for the specified query
        Parameters:
        searchQuery - the query to execute
        searchFilter - the query filter to apply
        groupField - field to group results by or null
        groupLimit - maximum results to retrieve per group
        fetchSize - number of records to fetch
        debug - if true, tells Solr to dump diagnostics on this query including an explanation of the scoring. Very useful during development but a huge performance penalty. Do not use in production.
        Returns:
        complete solr url for this query

      • buildPagingSearchParams

        SolrQuery buildPagingSearchParams(java.lang.String searchQuery,
                                java.lang.String searchFilter,
                                java.lang.String groupField,
                                int groupLimit,
                                java.lang.String sortOrder,
                                int fetchStart,
                                int fetchSize,
                                boolean debug)
        Constructs a search url for the specified query
        Parameters:
        searchQuery - the query to execute
        searchFilter - the query filter to apply
        groupField - field to group results by or null
        groupLimit - maximum results to retrieve per group
        sortOrder - fields and direction sort by
        fetchStart - index of first record desired result set
        fetchSize - number of records to fetch
        debug - if true, tells Solr to dump diagnostics on this query including an explanation of the scoring. Very useful during development but a huge performance penalty. Do not use in production.
        Returns:
        complete solr url for this query

      • buildArchiveSearchParams

        SolrQuery buildArchiveSearchParams(java.lang.String searchQuery,
                                 boolean debug)
        Constructs a search url that retrieves all matching records for a simple query in json format. Used for managing document updates when active and archived documents are in separate data stores.
        Parameters:
        searchQuery - the query to execute
        debug - if true, tells Solr to dump diagnostics on this query including an explanation of the scoring. Very useful during development but a huge performance penalty. Do not use in production.
        Returns:
        complete solr url for this query

      • getNamedChild

        gw.xml.XmlElement getNamedChild(gw.xml.XmlElement node,
                              java.lang.String name)
        For interpreting XML formatted Solr results. Retrieves the first child node where the "name" attribute has the specfied value.
        Parameters:
        node - parent node to get child from
        name -
        Returns:
        child node whose name attribute is 'fieldName'

      • getChildByAttribute

        gw.xml.XmlElement getChildByAttribute(gw.xml.XmlElement node,
                                    java.lang.String attrName,
                                    java.lang.String value)
        For interpreting XML formatted Solr results. Retrieves the first child node where the specified attribute has the specfied value.
        Parameters:
        node - parent node to get child from
        attrName -
        value - value to match with that of attribute
        Returns:
        child node whose name attribute is 'fieldName'

      • isType

        boolean isType(gw.xml.XmlElement node,
             java.lang.String type)
        For interpreting XML formatted Solr results. Checks that the node type (e.g. tag name) of the specified element matches the type passed in.
        Parameters:
        node - node on which to check the type
        type - type name to match, e.g str, date, float, arr, etc.
        Returns:
        true if the tag name of this node matches the specified type, false otherwise.

      • validate

        void validate(boolean condition,
            java.lang.String msg)
        If condition is not true, throws an exception with the specified message.
        Parameters:
        condition - true for valid, false otherwise
        msg - message to use if validation fails.

      • validateLazyMsg

        void validateLazyMsg(boolean condition,
                   block():String blk)
        If condition is not true, throws an exception with the specified message where message is lazily computed by the passed in block
        Parameters:
        condition - true for valid, false otherwise
        blk - block returning the message to use if validation fails.

      • getSchemaConfigReader

        SolrSchemaConfigReader getSchemaConfigReader(java.io.File configFile)
        Retrieve the SolrSchemaConfigReader for the specified config file. Cached in production but read from disk each time in dev mode.
        Parameters:
        configFile -
        Returns:
        a validated instance of the SolrSchemaConfigReader for this document

      • wrapAndThrow

        void wrapAndThrow(java.lang.Exception e)
        Utility method to ensure an exception is propagated upward typed as gw.solr.SolrException. Exceptions that are the correct type are simply thrown. All others are wrapped as SolrException and then thrown.
        Parameters:
        e - the exception to be wrapped
